name: Restrepia tsubatae
description: Restrepia tsubatae is an epiphytic orchid native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Colombia and Ecuador. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and features upright stems (5-10 cm tall) with small, dramatic, lance-shaped, dark green leaves and distinctive small flowers. The plant displays an upright growth habit. In its native habitat, it grows on tree branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant is perfect for small spaces and terrariums. It's popular among orchid enthusiasts for its compact size.
careTips: Water when media begins to dry
Bright indirect light - avoid direct sun
Feed with orchid fertilizer during growing season
